node.title: The cleanest jet fuel has an explosive history. Would you board a hydrogen plane?
node.alt: A model showing a white plane in flight.
node.description: As the world looks for new ways to combat climate change, hydrogen has emerged as a potential saviour for polluting industries like aviation. But will it work?
node.content:
["As the world looks for new ways to combat climate change, hydrogen has emerged as a potential\u00a0saviour for polluting industries like aviation.", "It's the most common element in the world,\u00a0and packs more energy than conventional aviation jet fuel without the side effect of producing massive emissions of carbon dioxide.", "But hydrogen and air travel have a complicated history.", "More than 80 years ago the hydrogen-filled Hindenburg airship burst into flames when attempting to moor at Lakehurst in New Jersey.", "The extent to which the buoyant hydrogen gas can be blamed for the disaster has been the subject of much debate.", "", "
The Hindenburg burst into flames and came crashing\u00a0to the ground in 1937.(US Navy: Gus Pasquarella via Wikimedia Commons)
", "But the image of the airship crashing to the ground is something the aviation industry is hoping to leave behind as it re-embraces hydrogen.", "One company is confident it can make it work, and is hoping to take paying passengers on a hydrogen-powered flight within just a few years.", "
The push for hydrogen flight
", "From its base at Kemble in England's scenic Cotswolds,\u00a0ZeroAvia is developing an aircraft that could make the world's first commercial hydrogen-electric flight in 2024, between London and Rotterdam in the Netherlands.", "The benefit of using hydrogen fuel cells, ZeroAvia argues, is that the only waste product is clean water.", "\"It's essentially a zero-emission process,\" says Sergey Kiselev, who heads ZeroAvia's Europe division.", "\"The only by-product is water vapour.\"", "The concept has won financial backing from the UK government and from IAG, the parent company of\u00a0British Airways.", "While hydrogen played at least a partial role in the Hindenburg crash, the team at ZeroAvia says modern storage systems make it a reliable fuel.", "\"Certainly hydrogen is safe,\" says John Kells, the company's head of technical operations.", "\"Today there are electric vehicles with hydrogen fuel cell systems and it's not more dangerous than\u00a0kerosene [which fuels modern-day jets].\"", "Hydrogen is much lighter than air, so will quickly dissipate when released, unlike regular fuel, ZeroAvia says.", "But developing the plane hasn't been easy.", "In September 2020,\u00a0the team from ZeroAvia\u00a0reached a major milestone after performing\u00a0a take-off, circuits\u00a0and landing in a six-seater Piper Malibu\u00a0powered by hydrogen fuel cells.", "The plane carried out\u00a0dozens of successful test flights. Then in April this year, it crashed.", "", "
The 6-seat hydrogen fuel cell plane was badly damaged during a test flight but nobody was injured.(Supplied)
", "The plane made a forced landing in a field near Cranfield airport, in Bedfordshire.", "While trying to come to a stop on the uneven surface, one of its wings was torn off. Nobody was\u00a0hurt.", "\"I think when you test novel technology, things like that happen,\"\u00a0Mr Kiselev tells the ABC.", "He says while the incident is still being investigated, the hydrogen itself was not the cause.", "\"We've gone through quite a bit of learning \u2026 to avoid that and make sure that doesn't happen\u00a0again.\"", "Stephen\u00a0Lawes, who was on the plane when it crashed, is still convinced hydrogen is the future.", "\"The technology we've got today works,\" he\u00a0says.", "\"You don't have to wait until 2030, 2040, 2050. You can do it now, basically.\"", "Just outside ZeroAvia's hangar at the airport in the Cotswolds are dozens of fossil-fuel-guzzling passenger\u00a0jets.", "They were sent there for temporary storage during the COVID-19 pandemic.\u00a0But the long-term future of some of these jets is in doubt, amid a push for greener flying.", "
'Flight shame' prompts focus on green travel
", "As travel restrictions ease, passengers are keen to return to the skies.", "The International Air Transport Association (IATA) is forecasting 3.4 billion passengers next year, up\u00a0from 2.3 billion in 2021.", "", "
Some young travellers\u00a0say they plan\u00a0to reduce their air travel as a result of worries around global warming.(AAP: Paul Miller)
", "At the same time, there is growing community awareness about air travel's contribution to climate\u00a0change.", "It currently accounts for about 2.5 per cent of global emissions, but some forecasts predict\u00a0that figure could reach about 25 per cent by 2050.", "A McKinsey survey of 5,300 passengers found that more than 50 per cent were \"really worried\" about\u00a0global warming.", "Forty per cent of those aged between 18 and 24 said they planned to reduce their air travel as a result.", "\"We've got the social support,\" Mr Lawes says.", "\"There's this big wave coming, supporting change.\"", "", "
Taking Off: What it takes to get planes back in the air
", "Instead of building a new plane from scratch, ZeroAvia\u00a0is installing hydrogen gas tanks inside a 19-seat Dornier\u00a0228 regional airliner.", "The company is\u00a0hoping airlines will be more likely to adopt the technology if they can add it to their existing\u00a0planes.", "The hydrogen fuel cells will power electric motors, which will rotate the propellers.", "\"It sounds easy, but it isn't,\" Mr Lawes cautions.", "ZeroAvia make their own fuel on-site, passing an electrical current through water to split it into oxygen\u00a0and hydrogen.", "\"The beauty of hydrogen electrolysis is it needs only two inputs. One is water, the second is\u00a0electricity,\" Mr Kiselev says.", "", "
Sergey Kiselev says his team learnt\u00a0important lessons when their plane crashed.(ABC News:\u00a0Andrew Greaves)
", "However, for the process to be truly carbon zero, the electricity needs to come from renewable sources.", "Mr Kiselev says so-called green hydrogen\u00a0presents\u00a0big opportunities for countries like\u00a0Australia.", "\"Especially in Australia with all the solar resources, there can be quite a bit of renewable power \u2026\u00a0generated very close to airports,\" he says.", "Green hydrogen currently accounts for just 1\u00a0per cent of global supply.\u00a0But it's not the only\u00a0pathway to a greener future for aviation.", "
Alternative green options\u00a0for travel
", "For small planes, electric propulsion is already shaping up as a viable alternative.", "But while batteries\u00a0are becoming increasingly efficient, they still don't pack the punch required for longer trips.", "", "
Passenger jets in storage at the Cotswolds airport.(ABC News: Andrew Greaves)
", "One of the world's biggest aircraft manufacturers, Airbus, is also putting its faith in hydrogen. But\u00a0instead of using the gas to supply a fuel cell, it plans to burn hydrogen in its liquid form.", "It's working on three concept designs for a 'ZEROe' aircraft, which it's hoping to have in service by\u00a02035.", "One of them looks unlike any passenger aircraft currently in the sky, requiring a radical\u00a0new design if it's to store enough hydrogen to fly long-haul.", "Jo Dardenne, the aviation manager at the European sustainability group Transport and Environment,\u00a0says the world can't wait until 2035 to drastically cut long-haul airline emissions.", "\"You don't need a new airframe like a hydrogen plane, you can just use today's technology,\" she says.", "Ms Dardenne says sustainable aviation fuel (SAFs) like e-kerosene, also known as electrofuel or\u00a0synthetic kerosene, provide\u00a0the best short-term solution.", "That's\u00a0because it can be blended with\u00a0conventional jet fuel (kerosene) and used in today's aircraft.", "\"That's the beauty of electrofuel. It can be treated as normal kerosene.\"", "The fuel is made by combining green hydrogen with CO2 captured from the atmosphere, at high\u00a0temperature. This produces a crude oil which is later refined.", "When it's burned, e-kerosene emits the same amount of carbon as was previously removed from the\u00a0atmosphere during its production, making it carbon neutral.", "In January, Dutch airline KLM flew the first regular passenger journey using sustainably-produced\u00a0synthetic kerosene.", "However, the 500 litres produced by oil giant Shell represented just 5\u00a0per cent of the total fuel needed for\u00a0the flight from Amsterdam to Madrid.", "Sustainable synthetic kerosene isn't being produced on a large scale. In October, a new plant opened\u00a0in Germany, promising to produce just over 300 gallons a day.", "That would only fill about 5\u00a0per cent of a single Boeing 737-800's fuel tanks.", "Jo Dardenne says that until production is drastically ramped up, electrofuels will struggle to compete with\u00a0cheaper jet fuel.", "\"That's why we need governments to invest in them\u2026 and make sure they force airlines to shift\u00a0towards those kinds of fuels.\"", "Yet while all these technologies promise to reduce the airline industry's carbon emissions, one major\u00a0problem remains.", "
Carbon is not the only enemy
", "If you look up at the sky, sometimes you can spot white condensation trails behind a plane when it passes\u00a0overhead.", "These are called contrails, and according to scientists, they can have a significant impact on the environment.", "", "
Contrails are largely made of water vapour that comes out of aircraft exhausts.(Wikimedia Commons: NOAA)
", "\"The consensus is\u2026 contrails have an effect that is similar in magnitude, if not larger, than the total\u00a0effect from CO2 emissions,\" says Dr Marc Stettler, a senior lecturer in transport and the environment\u00a0at Imperial College London.", "A plane's hot exhaust produces water vapour which clings to soot particles emitted from the\u00a0engines.", "In the cold sky, these particles freeze, creating clouds of ice crystals.", "While the clouds can sometimes reflect the sun's radiation and cool the planet, Dr Stettler says the\u00a0overall effect is to trap heat that would otherwise be lost into space.", "However, there is a potential solution.", "By predicting the atmospheric conditions that are most likely to produce the longest-lasting\u00a0contrails, airlines and traffic controllers can stop planes flying through them.", "After studying Japanese airspace, researchers at Imperial College, led by Dr Stettler, concluded that\u00a0by altering the altitude of less than 2\u00a0per cent of total flights, you could reduce contrail-related\u00a0climate change by 59 per cent.", "\"This isn't something that we need to do for every single flight\" he tells the ABC.", "\"[But] I do think we need to be creative about how we reduce the climate impact of aviation.\"", "E-kerosene promises to reduce the impact of contrails\u00a0by burning more cleanly than regular jet fuel.", "Hydrogen combustion engines like those planned by Airbus will be even cleaner, but may still emit\u00a0particles that cause contrails to form, Dr Stettler says.", "And hydrogen fuel cell aircraft, like Zero Avia's, will theoretically produce only water vapour.", "But Dr Stettler says it's still unclear how quickly those contrails will disappear.", "\"In terms of hydrogen [planes], the jury's out in terms of their effect on contrails.\"", "He says while technology catches up, passengers may have to think carefully about the impact their\u00a0flights are having on the environment, and potentially pay more for their pollution.", "But he hopes the \"privilege\" of flight can still be experienced by more than just the most fortunate in\u00a0society.", "\"We are a global community and I think we are better for it.", "\"We really don't want to be building walls.\""]
